entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 6:37AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Windy With Blowing Snow Over Summits Tonight Into Tuesday... ...Chance of Freezing Rain Tonight And Monday... A weather front approaching from the west tonight will bring snow and blowing snow to the Summits of the Steese and Elliott Highways tonight through Tuesday. Summits could get up to 4 inches of snow. Summits could have west widns of 20 to 30 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED WATER ALONG COAST THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... Southerly gales along the West Coast have caused sea level rises of 3-4 ft today. This will cause water to seep up on top of the ice near the West Coast today through Mon, similar to what occurred earlier this week. This could affect snow machine trails across ice near the the coast.
